lines.text: You go. We go.
Look at him... That's my brother goddammit!
Gentlemen, gentlemen, gentlemen. As 17's official toastmaster...
...and bullshitter.
Thank you, Santos. Did I happen to mention you're cut out of my will?
[Continuing]

I think it appropriate that we recognize the two asswipes... Probationary Firemen... among us today who were officially baptized into the world of Old Man Fire. First, to Tim. Despite the fact that he has a rather dull expression, and a really hideous pair of ears; he not only took on the beast but pulled from its clutches, assisted by a more famous and brilliant firefighter, me, a kicking and screaming civilian who will probably wind up suing us for breaking her fingernails. And to Brian! Help me Santos!...

[pulls up mannequin]
Here she is!

...whose own contribution was not only more beautiful but less likely to sue. You know, when I learned that both McCaffrey brothers would be assigned at the same station together at the same time, my heart was filled with... a sudden desire to transfer. So raise a glass, gents. To funny-looking Tim, and the McCaffrey brothers, who have gotten on each other's nerves and still managed after all these years to still be pissed off at each other. Gentlemen...

[jokingly]
FUCK YOU!
In a word, Brian, what is this job all about?
Fire.

It's a living thing, Brian. It breathes, it eats, and it hates. The only way to beat it is to think like it. To know that this flame will spread this way across the door and up across the ceiling, not because of the physics of flammable liquids, but because it wants to. Some guys on this job, the fire owns them, makes 'em fight it on it's level, but the only way to truly kill it is to love it a little. Just like Ronald.

The only problem is that in this job is there's just no place to hide. It's not like having a bad day selling log cabins. You have a bad day here and somebody dies... and that's just not fucking good enough.
You see that glow flashing in the corner of your eye? That's your career dissipation light. It just went into high gear.

[at Ronald's parole hearing]
What about the world, Ronald? What would you like to do to the whole world?
Burn it all.
[laughs]
See you next year, Ronald.
Hey, Axe, you know this rug rat?
Know him? I practically raised him.
He never calls. He never writes.

[introducing himself]
I'm Brian.
I'm sorry.
I sent away for the copy of Life magazine. The one with your picture on the front. It's a collectible.
Who's doing this, Ronald?
Wrong question. Who isn't? It's not a spark because there's not enough damage. He wouldn't have had any fun. It's not an insurance scam because there isn't any profit.
Do you know who's doing this?
Yes.
Then tell me.
You want to know who? I want to know if this kid really wanted to be just like his dad.
I wanted to be him. I wanted to be him more than anything else in the world.
And you loved him?
Yeah.
And you watched him dance with the animal. You saw your dad burn.
Fuck you Ronald. Who's doing this, huh?

Did it look at you? Did the fire look at you? It did. Whoa. Wow. Our worlds aren't that far apart after all, are they? So, whoever is doing this knows the animal well, doesn't he? He knows him real well, but he won't let him loose. He won't let him have any fun, so he does not love him. Now who doesn't love fire? And is around trychtichlorate all day long?

[realizes who it might be]
Oh my God!
See... that wasn't such a long trip after all.
The funny thing about firemen is... Night and day they are always firemen.

So stop me if I got this wrong. Now the fire is almost out, you're upstairs on the unburned floor checking for heat, is that correct? And you've been told by your Battalion Chief, your Captain and by me not to do nothin', right? Not to do nothin' until ordered. That's correct, right?
Yes, sir.
Ok. But now the itch starts. The 'Glory Boy' flash starts. 'Hey, I'm a hero. Heroes don't just stand around.' You can tell me, that's what it was, wasn't it?
Yes, sir.
So you punched out a window for ventilation. Was that before or after you noticed you were standing in a lake of gasoline?
[shouting]
Was that BEFORE OR AFTER you noticed you were standing in a lake of GASOLINE, YOU IDIOT?
Before, sir.

You could have burned or killed or crispened half that company! To say nothing of the fact that you wrecked the physical evidence that I use to prove that it's arson, and you know how goddamned hard it is to determine the cause of these fires! Now you go home and you think about that!
You had to do it, didn't you? Had to be the big Mick Man, taking on the fire bare-handed instead of protecting your probe?
I *had it* under control! He just wouldn't listen to me!
He's a *candidate*! YOUR RESPONSIBILITY! You shouldn't have had him up there in the *first place*!
[Steven walks away]
YOU BURNED HIM, STEVEN!
FUCK YOU!
[keeps walking away]
Don't you walk away from me...
[Steven turns aroung and slugs Brian]
[Brian goes after Steven, resulting in a brawl]
Your Dad died saving my life and these people were killing firemen for MONEY!
Who's your brother Brian?
You are Steven.
[In high rise elevator]
How are we supposed to know if the floor is on fire in one of these?
When the doors open, if it's hot, don't get out.
[Rimgale and Brian McCaffrey in the morgue with the medical examiner]
McCaffrey, come on over and give us a hand.
No, I don't think so. Not in my contract.

[Throwing medical gloves at him]
I just rewrote your contract. Come give us a hand.

[to Brian in the morgue about picking up the burned body]
Jesus Christ! He's not going to sell you insurance, pick him up!
[Rimgale and Brian crash Alderman Swayzak's press conference]
These detectives would like to question you on how come you paid Donald Cosgrove, Jeffrey Holcum and Allan Seagrave to create a phony manpower study!
[throws the files at the media, resulting in a barrage of questions]

[to the media]
Ask him who made money off firemen dying!
These high-rise gigs give me the creeps.
Let's go.
Where we going?
Pest control.

[after looking at the fire station's muddy swamp creature looking dog]
You guys got something against Dalmatians?

[Steven enters after having saved a child from the fire]
Man, that was pretty crazy, huh?
I waited. I would've waited.
Come on, don't worry about it.
But you did it man. You did it all the way. You were really a hero.
Brian... its not about being a hero. I went in because there was a kid up there. I do what I do because that's my way. And it was Dad's way. Maybe it's not everybody's way.

[Steven enters after having saved a child from the fire]
Man, that was pretty crazy, huh?
I waited. I woulda waited.
Come on, don't worry about it.
But you did it man. You did it all the way Steven, you were really a hero today.
Brian... its not about being a hero. I went in because there was a kid up there. You know, I just, I do what I do because that's my way. And it was Dad's way. Maybe it's not everybody's way.

[to Brian]
You got a real short memory for following direct orders... I told you to stay right beside me.

[scolding Brian]
I told you to stay right befucking side me BRIAN!
We believe you're holding back on us, to embarass the Alderman because of his fire department cutbacks.

To determine if a fire is arson or not, and if so, to catch the son of a bitch doing it. And if my investigative methods happen to muck up the campaign of certain mayor wannabes, I gotta tell ya... I'm not gonna go losing any sleep over it.
You see that glow in the corner of your eye. It's your career dissapation light and it's going into overtime.
If anyone's lights are about to go out, believe me they are yours.
Yeah, it's jumping floors, Lieutenant!
Well, where's the second-in companies, huh?
Sorry, man, John Wayne time. You're on your own, boss.
When are you catch the prick who's doing this, Don?
Don?
Don't you have any leads?
No, *Marty*, I don't.
Who's your brother, Brian?
You are, Steven.
Now on a lucky shot, we picked up something, what was it...? Trychtichlorate.
Oh, yeah, trychtichlorate. Needs magnesium. It's pretty rare. They stopped making it a couple of years ago.
We figured it probably got on his clothes in a gas state from the fire.
What was it doing in the fire?
That's your job.

[after Steven saves a child]
Dad's way? What? Did he tell you that in a fucking séance, Stephen? Huh?
Hey, do you need a second lead out?
What?
A second lead out.
What the fuck are you talking about? Get outta here!
Would you stay still already? What a geek!
I'm not a geek!

[tries to get Brian to hold still and re-adjust the protective neck collar on the fire jacket]
You're doing it wrong!
Shut up!
You're doing it wrong! It doesn't go like that!
Who asked you?
Who's your brother?
You are, Stevie!
That's right! You do it like this, it'll open up in a fire and you'll get burned and die.

[rushes when the fire bell rings]
Let's go! Hey, Brian!
[turns to John]
What've you got there, Adcox? A big deal?
Medium deal, Captain.

[turns back to Brian]
Hey, Brian! Wanna come along and watch your old man earn his keep?

[disappointed]
Dad!
Aw, Stephen, you've come a dozen times! Now, give your brother a chance! Huh? We'll be back in a minute.
[turns to Brian]
How 'bout it, sport?

[as he puts his helmet on Brian's head]
C'mon!
